title: Business and Financial Operations Specialist
description:
**Company Overview** 




 Pantheon Data (a Kenific Holding company) is a private, small business based in the Washington, DC, area. Pantheon Data was founded in 2011, initially providing acquisition and supply chain management services to the US Coast Guard. Our service offerings have grown in the past ten years, including infrastructure resiliency, contact center operations, information technology, software engineering, program management, strategic communications, engineering, and cybersecurity. We have also grown our customer base to include commercial clients. The company has used this experience to expand our service offerings to other agencies within the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), the Department of Defense (DoD), and other Federal Civilian Agencies.
 



**Position Overview** 




 Pantheon Data is seeking a
 **Business and Financial Operations Specialist** 
 to support the full spectrum of the Planning, Programming Budgeting and Execution (PPBE) cycle. The position shall provide the required budgetary and programmatic support to ODASA(R\\&T). The contractor shall provide support staff who possess a balanced skill set that includes relevant experience, business/programmatic skills, and the ability to achieve mission objectives quickly and efficiently.
 



**Responsibilities** 



* Perform analysis of obligation and disbursement rates of all funds under ODASA(R\\&T) purview using Army financial databases and tools such as General Fund Enterprise Business Systems (GFEBS)
* Coordinate the Army S\\&T budget with AFC, DCS G\\-8, the Army Budget Office, and OSD.
* Develop and maintain audit trails of the changes in budget positions (POM, BES and President's Budget) through the use of the cPROBE data warehouse; analyze manpower data.
* Plan, coordinate and implement execution reviews to ensure funds meet established goals.
* Ensure Program Managers, Directors and their staff receive timely updates regarding changes in funding positions with a sufficient level of detail and necessary data fields to allow them to make informed decisions.
* Provide Program Managers, Directors and their staff financial measures of performance and effectiveness for their programs (e.g., return on investment), the associated analysis, and advice regarding financial risks and opportunities.
* Serve as the technical lead for the annual E\\-GOV data call; support S\\&T input to the Strategic Portfolio Analysis Review (SPAR).
* Facilitate Congressional inquiries, including Procurement \\& RDT\\&E form (P\\&R Form) Submission
* Support the Program Objective Memorandum (POM) development, including data analysis, briefing development, and data management.
* Provide and validate financial information for briefings and inquiries; and attend budget meetings, program reviews, and other events/meetings as directed by the government.
* The position shall derive technical and programmatic information, prepare Executive summaries, briefings, point papers, tasker responses and other products as necessary to apprise the ODASA(R\\&T) staff of relevant issues and developments related to budgetary, programmatic, and technical concerns, particularly those with impact across various technology areas, providing decision information for Senior Army Executives as well as DoD officials.



**Required Skills and Experience** 



* Bachelor's degree in relevant field of study (finance, accounting)
* Ten years of experience in budgeting.
* Eight years of experience with Army or DoD budgeting processes.
* General Fund Enterprise Business Systems (GFEBS) experience.
* Secret Clearance



**Preferred Skills and Experience** 



* Experience developing and managing Army PPBE processes.
* Implementing innovative budgeting processes.
* Assist with development and implementation of standardized budgeting processes and briefings, SOPs, and best practices for program personnel.



**Clearance Requirements** 




 U.S. Citizenship with the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret clearance.
 



**Work Location:** 
 Arlington, VA \\- Hybrid
 


* Our company prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.
* If the position is remote or hybrid, you may periodically work from a Pantheon Data office location or client site.
* If this position is assigned to a Pantheon Data office location or client site, you'll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for specific client requirements.



**Compensation** 




 The salary range for this position is $140,000 \\- $150,000\\. This is not, however, a guarantee of compensation or salary. Rather, salary will be set based on experience, geographic location and possibly contractual requirements and could fall outside of this range.
 



**Benefits Overview** 




 We are always looking for good people! Pantheon Data is committed to providing its employees with competitive salaries and benefits in order to increase employee satisfaction and productivity. In addition to our benefits, we also offer SmartBenefits through the Washington Metro Area Transportation Authority, where you specify an amount of your pre\\-tax wages be paid directly to your SmarTrip account. In some cases, tuition assistance may be available for continuing education expenses and certifications related to their position. Additional details may be found at https://pantheon\\-data.com/careers/
 



**Pantheon Data Important Information** 




 All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.
 



 As part of the application process, you are expected to be on camera during interviews and assessments. We reserve the right to take your picture to verify your identity and prevent fraud.
 



 If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre\\-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to our Talent Team at Recruiting@pantheon\\-data.com or by phone (571\\) 363\\-4020\\.

title: Weather Upper Air Data Analyst - (SME III)
description:
**Job Title:** 
 Weather Upper Air Data Analyst \\- (SME III)
   

**Location** 
 : Silver Spring, MD and Sterling, VA \\- Hybrid
   

**Clearance Required:** 
 Public Trust Eligible
   

**Salary** 
 : $105k \\- $110K
   

**Application Deadline:** 
 March 31, 2025
   

  

**To apply, please follow these steps:** 
* Visit
 **https://ibsscorp.com/careers/** 
 .
* Select the position you are interested in.
* Review the job details, then click
 **Apply Now** 
 .
* Complete and submit your application.


  

**Description** 
  

 IBSS is seeking an experienced technical support subject matter expert to support the National Weather Service, Surface and Upper Air Division (NWS SUAD). The position requires the preparation and maintenance of detailed project schedules for performing tasks in an integrated workflow environment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:** 
  

  

 Engineering
 * Conduct engineering analyses, investigations, and assessments of upper air observing systems.
* Provide maintenance engineering support and assistance
* Maintenance Documentation
* Help develop, generate, update, and revise maintenance documentation, including maintenance notes, modification notes, and site technical manuals, technical information packages (TIP), technical notes, and other related publications.
   

  

**Logistics**
* Manage inventories, shipping, payment and arrival/receiving.
* Communicate with vendors and users


**Required Skills /Education/ Certifications \\& Qualifications:** 
  

  

 Bachelor's degree in Engineering, with a focus in electrical, mechanical or other related technical discipline
   

 8\\+ years of progressive engineering management experience in both functional and program roles.
   

 Demonstrated experience in the operation and maintenance of weather equipment, software development for monitoring and tracking equipment performance, field maintenance including fault isolation and repair of electronic equipment at the modular replacement level, and the installation, maintenance, alignment, and repair of electronic equipment.
   

  

**Desired Skills:** 
  

  

**Project Management** 
* Develops and maintains detailed project schedules for performing tasks in an integrated workflow environment.


 Communicates task status and schedule changes promptly with the federal task manager and produces weekly status reports highlighting task completion schedules, work schedule variations (if any), other milestones and work product deliveries.
   

  

**Engineering and Technical Support** 
* Supports the management of NWS national sounding systems field program, involving a variety of complex radar adjuncts, upper air systems, and equipment including radar information display systems, automatic radiosonde system, and hydrogen generators.
* Assists the maintenance program engineer (MPE) in performing documentation tasks, systems maintenance activities, integrated logistics support, failure analysis, and engineering reporting.
* Provides technical writing and web page maintenance to meet the goals and objectives of the Division.
* Conducts engineering analyses, investigations, and assessments of airborne and upper air systems.
* Develops, generates, updates, and revises maintenance documentation, including maintenance notes, modification notes, and site technical manuals, technical information packages (TIP), technical notes, and other related publications.


  

**About IBSS Corp.** 
  

 Since 1992, IBSS, a woman\\-owned small business, has provided transformational consulting services to the Federal defense, civilian, and commercial sectors. Our services include cybersecurity and enterprise information technology, environmental science and engineering (including oceans, coasts, climate, and weather), and professional management services.
   

  

 Our approach is to serve our employees by investing in their growth and development. As a result, our employees bring greater capabilities and provide exceptional service to our clients. In addition to creating career development opportunities for our employees, IBSS is passionate about giving back to the community and serving the environment. We strive to leave something better behind for the next generation.
   

  

 We measure our success by the positive impact we have on our employees, clients, partners, and the communities we serve. Our tagline, Powered by Excellence, is a recognition of the employees that make up IBSS and ensures we deliver results with quality, applying industry best practices and certifications.
   

 IBSS offers a competitive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, and prescription drug coverage with a company\\-paid deductible, paid time off, federal holidays, a matching 401K plan, tuition/professional development reimbursement, and Flex\\-Spending (FSA)/Dependent Care Account (DCA) options.
   

  

 IBSS is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. Click https://www.eeoc.gov/poster to see that the EEO is the law. Please direct any inquiries to the HR Department email at HR@ibsscorp.com.
   

  

 If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre\\-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to the Talent Acquisition department at Recruiting@ibsscorp.com

title: Vice President, Information Services (IS) and Chief Information Officer (CIO)
description:
**Job Type:** 



 Regular
 








**Vice President, Information Services (IS) and Chief Information Officer (CIO)** 




 The problems facing humanity are daunting. As a research institution devoted to helping make communities across the world safer, healthier, and more prosperous, RAND plays a key role in analyzing public policy issues and developing recommendations to tackle them for high\\-level government sponsors and the stakeholders that engage with them. This requires cutting\\-edge analytic computing capabilities, computing that enables high productivity and effective management, and the ability to seamlessly collaborate among dispersed teams and with research sponsors and partners. And it is critical for RAND to remain a trusted government partner by upholding the highest standards of information security.
 







 To accomplish this, RAND's IS team, led by the Vice President, IS and CIO, works in partnership with the rest of RAND's senior leadership, the research divisions, and the other operations departments to ensure RAND has leading IS capabilities. Reporting to the senior vice president of finance and operations, the CIO will have the knowledge and leadership skills to provide world\\-class information services, including accelerating our efforts to be at the cutting edge of using rapidly advancing AI capabilities.
 











**About RAND** 




 RAND provides critical insights on a wide range of policy issues spanning security, health, education, and much more. Our work is sponsored by governments and nonprofit organizations and is also supported by philanthropy. To uphold our commitment to the public interest and trust in RAND, our research is rigorous and free of commercial, political, and ideological bias; we ensure independence through evidence\\-based analysis, funding transparency, open publication within the bounds of information security requirements, and conflicts of interest reviews; and we maintain the highest standards of conduct in everything we do.
 







 We foster a culture of inclusiveness, collegiality, teamwork, intellectual openness, and integrity. Combined with our mission, this enables us to attract diverse top\\-tier research and operations talent who are mission\\-driven and have the belief that no problem is too big, complex, or controversial to take on.
 











**Position Description** 




 With a focus on setting strategy and leading IS staff to execute to high standards, the CIO is responsible for RAND's information technology infrastructure encompassing on\\-premises and cloud\\-based capabilities, information security, business and research applications\\-including custom analytic applications, data management, a digital "library", and the research software engineering and data science group.
 



 As a senior leader at RAND, the CIO, working with their Leadership Team, will lead the continual evolution of RAND's IS strategy to ensure RAND is leveraging advances in computing and analytic technologies and that it stays well aligned with the strategies and research needs of RAND's research divisions. To do so, the CIO will collaborate closely with stakeholders across RAND to maintain a deep understanding of their business goals, challenges, and technology needs, along with offering new ideas on how technology and other IS capabilities can help them. And the CIO will oversee the deployment of technology solutions, including software, hardware, and cloud services, ensuring they support business objectives. This includes developing, deploying, and sustaining custom applications when merited.
 







 In addition to traditional information technology roles, RAND's IS Department plays a pivotal role in advancing RAND's research capabilities by leveraging cutting\\-edge computing technologies for analysis. This requires ensuring that the research computing infrastructure, consisting of high\\-performance computing and specialized analytic applications, can meet all research needs and stays at the cutting edge to enable RAND to offer innovative research. IS also includes RAND's research software engineers, research programmers, and data scientists, all of whom work on research teams and help RAND research teams maximally leverage technology capabilities. In addition, this continual engagement should also lead to the development of ideas for new advanced research information technology solutions offering improved analytic capabilities that can be brought to the research community for more effective or efficient analysis.
 







*Key responsibilities include:* 



* In collaboration with leaders across RAND, seeking to understand how their organizations operate, their priorities, and their requirements, develop, execute, and evolve an IT strategy that supports overall, division, and department priorities for research capabilities and operational efficiency.
* Driving the IS Team to continuously assess technology and cybersecurity solutions to ensure the organization is well\\-positioned for the future; lead the development of IT technology and capability roadmaps.
* Serves as the lead IS contact with the vice presidents of RAND research units to maintain awareness of research agendas to provide proactive management and delivery of capabilities.
* Ensure staff across RAND have the IT tools and environment to be productive and effective.
* Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of advanced research computing services, including high\\-performance computing and AI\\-based and other advanced applications.
* Develop and maintain AI\\-based tools, capabilities, and supporting infrastructure to advance research and improve operational efficiency.
* Manage the IT budget and ensure cost\\-effectiveness of technology investments.
* Oversee IT projects and initiatives, ensuring that they are delivered on time and within budget.
* Establish and maintain strong relationships with external IT vendors and service providers while also strategically managing spend to maximize cost\\-effectiveness of IT capabilities.
* Lead the IT department, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation; seek ongoing feedback to improve existing services.
* Staying aligned with best practices and standards as they evolve, and in partnership with the Chief Security Officer, ensure the security of all information systems and data and compliance with relevant regulations and standards.
* Oversee the development and implementation of RAND's IT architecture and computing infrastructure and ensure high reliability and resiliency.
* Working with the IS Leadership team and the Office of General Counsel, \\= review and update all relevant IS policies as needed.
* Hire, retain, and develop top information services talent
* Determine staffing needs and hires new staff.
* Guide the development of department staff, to include training and other developmental activities, to ensure effective career development and effective succession planning.
* Review performance of department staff.











**Qualifications** 



* Extensive experience in senior IT leadership roles, ideally encompassing IT operations, analytic application development and support, and data science
* Experience establishing organizational strategies and priorities in partnership with key stakeholders
* Broad knowledge of information technology operations and information security, familiarity with the latest computing capabilities available to enable analysis and for business operations, and deep IT knowledge to manage an IT workforce
* A track record of taking the initiative to prevent or solve problems and to seize new opportunities
* Experience managing an organization with a reputation for providing exceptional customer service
* Proven ability to lead and manage people in the organization to develop their skills and knowledge and achieve high organizational performance.
* Experience with IT budget and project management, including aligning resources with organizational priorities
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities
* Knowledge of cybersecurity and data protection practices and regulatory requirements

title: CMM Programmer
description:
Description
 



 Description
 



 Primus Aerospace is currently seeking a CMM Programmer to join our Quality team in our Reisterstown facility. 
 



 Primus Aerospace is a leading manufacturing partner to aerospace, defense \\& space OEMs / Primes \\& Tier I suppliers. The company specializes in producing high\\-tolerance, complex geometry parts; machined out of standard and exotic metals. Primus works directly with all major aerospace manufacturers (e.g., Boeing, Lockheed, Northrop) to provide components to mission critical civilian and defense programs.
 



  





 Schedule: 2nd shift (M\\-F 3:30pm \\- 2:30am), base pay plus 10% night shift differential
 



  





 Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:
 



 Responsible for assuring that assigned activities are performed in accordance with their Quality Management System
 



 Create, revise and optimize offline and online CMM programs and reports to reflect customer print specification requirements
 



 Create CMM set up and operational instruction to part/ machine specific.
 



 Analyze and interpret CMM reports to determine adherence to customer prints, specifications
 



 Train and oversee use of CMM by inspectors
 



 Responsible for daily, weekly maintenance of CMM machines
 



 Responsible to ensure that the CMM Software (Calypso) is up to date and maintained.
 



 Ensure programs and all data generated by the CMM machines are stored correctly and backed up
 



 Provide support to QC team with FAI, In\\-Process or Final Inspection activities as needed.
 



 Prepare detailed inspection report such as written descriptions of inspection results, statistical analysis reports
 



 Provides technical assistance and training to production, manufacturing engineering, and quality personnel
 



 Serve as technical expert for GD\\&T and interpretation of AMSE Y14\\.5M. Stay current with GD\\&T standards, terminology and inspection methodologies
 



 Understand and follow internal inspection procedures and maintain inspection records
 



 Understand and maintain the ERP system per company policies
 



 Keep current with industry inspection techniques, practices and required standards. Be willing to perform other duties as assigned (Calibration, Audits, CAPA, Customer Complaints, RMAs, etc.)
 



 Perform First Piece, Lot and Final Inspections against customer requirements
 



  





 \\#zr
 



 Requirements
 



**Must be eligible to obtain Secret level security clearance** 




 Strong verbal and written communication
 



 First Article Inspection experience and data reporting
 



 Proven ability to troubleshoot CMM faults
 



 CMM work experience required
 



 Aerospace experience desired
 



**2\\+ years Calypso Zeiss CMM software experience** 




**Must have Calypso programming language experience** 




 Thorough knowledge of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD\\&T)
 



 Willingness to work overtime
 



 Ability to meet deadlines
 



  





 Pay Range: $25\\.00 \\- $35\\.00/hour
 



  





**IMPORTANT NOTICE:** 




  





 To adhere to U.S. Government international trade regulations, applicant must be a U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3\\), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State or U.S. Department of Commerce.
 



  





 Our work environment is fast\\-paced and professional while providing continued growth fostered by our commitment to teamwork. We offer comprehensive benefits including PTO, paid holidays, medical, dental and vision insurance, 401K, long\\-term and short\\-term disability.
 



  





 At Primus Aerospace, we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment that supports, respects, and celebrates all individuals.

title: Data Center Engineer
description:
Grow, innovate, and generate progress: Harness your expertise to solve challenges and celebrate success! 
   

  

**Job Summary:** 
  

  

 JCS Solutions has a need for an Imaging Technician for swing shift to join our growing team providing support services for information systems for Headquarters Air Force (HAF), Air Force District of Washington (AFDW), and other Air Force activities within the AF National Capital Region (AFNCR) missions to include the Pentagon, Joint Base Andrews (JBA), Joint Base Anacostia\\-Bolling (JBAB). This position offers an excellent opportunity to be part of a high\\-performing team responsible for supporting a high\\-velocity collaborative environment, along with tremendous growth potential. If you are interested in a challenge and a great working environment, apply today!
   

  

**What’s in it for you:** 
* Join a premier technology firm specializing in innovative solutions.
* Be part of a collaborative, inclusive, and innovative work culture.
* Enjoy tremendous growth potential in a high\\-performing team environment.
* A robust benefits package:
	+ Health, dental, and vision insurance
	+ Life insurance
	+ Short\\-and\\-long term disability
	+ Paid time off (PTO)
	+ 401k retirement plan with employer match
	+ Annual Professional Development Reimbursement Program
	+ And more!


**What you will do:** 
  

 The specific duties include but are not necessarily limited to the following:
 * Lead and assist with all design aspects of the CCC data center support systems, to include AC/DC power, UPS, HVAC, carrier infrastructures, internal/external cable plant, and overall data center layout.
* Produce architectural artifacts to include system design diagrams, recommendation justifications, and technical specifications.

* Create and review civil/structural/architectural design RFPs.
* Conduct site assessments, internal design meetings, construction reviews.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define the processes and standards that govern data center activities
* Coordinate and control access and logistic support
* Follow Datacenters procedures and processes
* Manage and coordinate the installation and maintenance of date center equipment
* Ensure compliance with data center security protocols
* Comfortable in a fast\\-paced environment.
* Technically strong and able to make quick, sound decisions.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills are a must.


**What you will bring:** 
  
 * SECRET DoD Clearance
* Bachelor’s Degree with 10\\+ years in Civil Engineering or the equivalent relevant experience in datacenter or mission critical facilities design.
* Active CompTia SEC\\+ CE Cert
* Data Center Management Certification a plus.
* Experience managing hardware configuration baselines
* Experience with Data Center Strategy, Planning, and Roadmap maintenance
* Knowledge of power infrastructure layout from generation to rack level, redundancy levels and techniques, rack standards, properties and selection criteria, and power rail/strip options, cold aisle/hot aisle containment, and standards for fire suppression, security and safety
* Proficiency in building codes, regulations, and standards
* Ability to build and maintain relationships, partnerships and external networks
* Ability to work independently, with minimal supervision and work effectively in a collaborative team environment while keeping the team informed.
* Excellent customer\\-facing skills.
* Excellent researching, decision\\-making and organizational skills are required.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Proven analytical, evaluative, and problem\\-solving abilities.
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite including Microsoft Visio or AutoCAD.
* Maintain confidentiality and adhere to data protection and other guidelines where appropriate.
* Ability to manage multiple responsibilities and assignments simultaneously under strict deadlines with minimal direction at times.
* Strong communication skills and ability to multi\\-task in a fast\\-paced environment.


**How you will wow us:** 
* Experience or familiarity with DCIM management software such as NLYTE.
* Working knowledge of the Air Force and/or DoD is a plus.


  

 JCS Solutions LLC (JCS) is a premier technology firm specializing in enterprise\\-wide capabilities including cloud and infrastructure solutions, cyber security, digital modernization, next generation technologies enablement, software solutions, and mission support services dedicated to providing the highest quality of services and solutions. JCS delivers expert management consulting and information technology (IT) solutions to federal agencies.
   

  

 We are a learning organization that promotes a work culture of collaboration, inclusiveness, inspiration and innovation.
   

  

 JCS has been certified as a
 ***Great Place to Work***
 four years in a row and was
 
 awarded as Washington Post’s
 ***Top Places to Work for 2024\\.***
  

  

 Our employees embody our core values, and we are looking for others who do too!
   

  
 * **Customer Experience:** 
  Strive for excellence and delight our clients
* **Innovation:** 
  Embrace creative thinking to enable continual growth and powerful solutions
* **Accountability:** 
  Take ownership of and pride in our actions and service delivery
* **Inspire:** 
  Be inspired to be your best self and have fun in the process
* **Integrity:** 
  Do the right thing, the right way, every time!
* **Stewardship:** 
  Careful management of something entrusted to us.

title: Implementation Consultant (Help Desk)

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience Bachelor's degree in engineering (Industrial, Mechanical, Electrical, Manufacturing, Software, etc.), Computer Science or other science and technology program, or equivalent years of relevant experience (5\\+ years) in design, engineering, manufacturing, logistics, data management 2 years of end user or implementation experience with enterprise PLM solutions such as Siemens Xcelerator Excellent analytical and problem\\-solving skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work independently, as well as on a team Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience Teamcenter experience preferred DoD 8570 IAT II certification, such as CompTIA Security\\+ or equivalent Solid understanding of processes and data for managing Bill\\-of\\-Materials (BOM) Solid understanding of Enterprise Change Management (ECM) Solid understanding of engineering and manufacturing processes Security Clearance United States citizen with no dual citizenship, ties to another country, foreign passports, or visas Ability to obtain a Secret Level U.S Government Security Clearance Work Location On\\-site at Hill Air Force Base

title: Subsidy Coordinator
description:
**Job Title:** 
 Subsidy Coordinator
 



**Department:** 
 Housing Services Team
 



**FLSA Status** 
 : Full\\-Time, Exempt
 



**Reports To:** 
 Director of Housing Services
 



**Direct Reports:** 
 None
 



**Issue Date:** 
 July 1, 2019
 



**Date Revised:** 
 January 28, 2025
 







 Housing Up is one of the leading non\\-profit organizations in Washington, DC providing the full spectrum of housing and supportive services to more than 700 homeless and at\\-risk families so that they can transform their own lives and sustainability. Housing programs include Housing Services, Permanent Supportive Housing, Rapid Rehousing, Transitional Housing, Residential Services and Affordable Rental Housing. Supportive services include case management, unit navigation services, employment services, clinical services, housing counseling, life skills and youth programming.
 



**POSITION SUMMARY** 



* The Subsidy Coordinator will report to the Director of Housing Services and assist the PSH Team and Finance Team with contract compliance and quality assurance.
* Performs initial and ongoing occupancy functions for participants of the TCP/HUD Veterans, Youth Families, HWC2 and Family voucher programs.
* Performs data entry, runs reports, ensures accuracy of data, and makes necessary corrections in the database before submitting to finance team.
* Responsible for maintaining all property manager contracts/correspondence and invoicing monthly subsidy payments.
* Responsible for monitoring intake/annual recertification for all households as well as issue notices (via phone, email and U.S. Postal services) to property manager and head of household for inspection dates.
* Manages timelines and accuracy of caseload for audit purposes and issue notifications accordingly.











**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS** 



* Generate client’s rent determination and provide to property manager during client’s relocation.
* Complete annual recertification and recalculate income to establish the client’s new rental portion based on most current household income documents provided.
* Coordinate and schedule inspections for approved relocations, annual inspections and re\\-inspections.
* Generate subsidy contracts and correspondence with property managers for relocations.
* Review and make final approval of the RFTA/Landlord leasing documents provided by the housing coordinator.
* Collect correspondence from the housing coordinator, property manager, inspector, and case manager to manage subsidy folders (inspection reports, rent determination letters, income statements, subsidy contracts and lease).
* Update and monitor leasing tracker for all lease\\-ups; update and monitor inspection tracker for all inspections.
* Submit monthly subsidy payment invoices to include subsidy and security deposit.
* Manage and audit subsidy workbook supplying correct and updated information to the finance team.
* Monitor timely payments and work with the finance team to resolve payment discrepancies.
* Submit invoice/tracker to the finance team for contracted inspector services.
* Provide an inspection schedule for the contracted inspector.
* Process rent increase request
* Support and attend external and internal program meetings/required trainings; other duties as requested.
* Create and maintain consistent communication channels, both verbal and written, between several parties (i.e. tenant, landlord, service providers, internal teams and collaborating agencies)
* *CERTIFICATES* 

 \\-This position requires COS (Certified Occupancy Specialist) certification to be completed within 90 days of employment.



*This job description provides a summary of the major duties and responsibilities performed by individuals in this position. Incumbents may be asked to perform other tasks not specifically written in this job.* 









**Required Qualifications** 



* Minimum 3 years of progressive experience with housing navigation and extensive knowledge of RFTA/Landlord Leasing Packet to include Security Deposit, Reconciliation, W9; C of O and, Basic Business License, DC /Federal Lead acknowledgement and HUD annual FMR (Fair Market Rates).
* Must have a current working knowledge of all Federal and Local laws pertaining to multi\\-family housing, and the delivery of services and implementation of housing programs for residents of low and moderate\\-income housing
* Experience with Microsoft software (concentration in Excel) and software packages used for implementation of housing programs.
* Exceptional interpersonal skills to include oral and written communication.
* Excellent customer service skills.
* Demonstrated ability to effectively multi\\-task and prioritize competing demands utilizing various internal systems while being highly organized with accuracy in work and attention to detail.
* Experience interpreting and administering complex regulations and performing mathematical computations.



  





**Preferred Qualifications** 



* Bachelor’s degree in social work or other human service field preferred;
* Experience using social services and/or property management database;
* Ability to adhere to strict standards of confidentiality and ethical conduct.







**Salary and Benefits** 




 $55,000 \\- $60,000 (Depending on qualifications and experience)
 



 This position is eligible for a
 **$2,000** 
 sign\\-on bonus!
 



 Housing Up offers a competitive benefits package including health insurance and a retirement plan, paid vacation, sick leave, and commuter benefits.
 



  





**Vaccine Protocol** 




 Housing Up has made the safety of our clients, staff, and our surrounding communities a top priority. As part of that commitment, the organization that all are required to be vaccinated against COVID. As a prospective and/or a new employee at Housing Up, you will be required to comply with the organizations vaccination protocol. Proof of full vaccination will be required before the start of employment in order to work at any Housing Up location. Prospective or new employees may seek a medical or religious exemption to the vaccination requirement from human resources and must have an approved exemption prior to the start of their employment. Failure to provide proof of vaccination or to obtain approval for medical or religious exemption will result in the offer of employment being rescinded.
 



**Housing Up is an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or disability status.**

title: .NET Developer- US Citizen
description:
**Req ID:** 
  311842 
 



 NTT DATA strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward\\-thinking organization, apply now.
 



 We are currently seeking a .NET Developer\\- US Citizen to join our team in Washington, District of Columbia (US\\-DC), United States (US).
 



**Job Title: .Net Developer** 




 NTT DATA is seeking a skilled and motivated Mid\\-Level Software Developer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will play a key role in the design, development, and implementation of high\\-quality software solutions within a fast\\-paced and collaborative environment. The ideal candidate will design, develop, and implement high\\-quality software solutions deployed in Microsoft Azure working in a collaborative environment and leverage your understanding of the .NET framework, object\\-oriented programming, and Azure cloud services. Experience working on government projects or with federal security requirements is a plus.
 



  
 



**Responsibilities:** 



* Designing and developing applications that can scale to meet demand and perform optimally in the cloud environment
* Participate in all phases of the software development lifecycle, including requirements gathering, design, coding, testing, deployment, and maintenance.
* Develop and maintain high\\-quality code using C\\# and the .NET framework, adhering to coding standards and best practices.
* Collaborate with other developers, testers, and stakeholders to ensure the timely delivery of software solutions.
* Troubleshoot and debug software issues, providing effective solutions to address identified problems.
* Contribute to the design and development of databases, ensuring data integrity and security.
* Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality and adherence to standards.
* Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for developed software.
* Adhere to federal security requirements and guidelines in the development and deployment of software solutions.
* Developing and deploying applications using Azure services Azure App Service, Azure Functions, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), Azure Storage, and Azure SQL Database.
* Implementing and managing cloud infrastructure with Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates, managing virtual machines, and configuring networking components.
* Applying security controls and following best practices for secure development in Azure.
* Familiarity with continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines in Azure DevOps or similar tools.
* Using tools like Terraform or ARM templates to manage infrastructure.
* Experience with containerization working with Docker and Kubernetes in Azure or similar.



  
 



**Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field and 6 years of work experience.
* Minimum 3 years of experience in software development using C\\# and the .NET framework or equivalent.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in software development, with a focus on web applications.
* Minimum 3 years experience in programming languages relevant to the environment (e.g., Java, typescript, Springboot).
* Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)
* **Must be a US Citizen** 
 and be able to obtain a Public Trust Clearance.
* **Must live a commutable distance from the client's offices in Washington, DC.**



**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* US Military Veteran
* Experience working on government projects or with federal security requirements (e.g., NIST 800\\-53, FISMA).
* Software development relevant certifications, such as Microsoft Certified Solutions Developer (MCSD) or equivalent.
* Experience with cloud technologies (e.g., Azure, AWS).



  
 



 \\#FEDSEC
 



**About NTT DATA** 




 NTT DATA is a $30 billion trusted global innovator of business and technology services. We serve 75% of the Fortune Global 100 and are committed to helping clients innovate, optimize and transform for long term success. As a Global Top Employer, we have diverse experts in more than 50 countries and a robust partner ecosystem of established and start\\-up companies. Our services include business and technology consulting, data and artificial intelligence, industry solutions, as well as the development, implementation and management of applications, infrastructure and connectivity. title: Data Scientist
description:
**Overview** 


 The Data Scientist plays a pivotal role in driving data\\-driven decisions within the organization. Leveraging large datasets, advanced analytical techniques, and machine learning algorithms, the Data Scientist is responsible for transforming data into actionable insights that help optimize business strategies and improve operational efficiency. This role requires a unique blend of statistical expertise, programming prowess, and a deep understanding of business processes. As organizations increasingly rely on data to inform their decisions, the Data Scientist serves as a strategic partner, collaborating with various teams to identify opportunities for enhancing performance and fostering innovation. The capacity to articulate complex findings in a clear and concise manner to stakeholders at all levels is essential. Ultimately, the Data Scientist not only extracts value from data but also plays a critical part in shaping the future direction of the organization through informed, empirical decision\\-making.
 

**Key Responsibilities** 

* Interpret complex data sets and facilitate data\\-driven business decisions.
* Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms to solve business problems.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to understand their data needs and objectives.
* Clean, preprocess, and visualize data to extract valuable insights.
* Utilize statistical analysis to test hypotheses and validate results.
* Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess business impact.
* Present findings and recommendations to both technical and non\\-technical stakeholders.
* Stay current with industry trends, tools, and best practices in data science.
* Design and implement experiments to optimize processes and drive innovation.
* Support the data strategy by identifying new data sources and novel analytical approaches.
* Implement data management strategies to ensure data quality and accessibility.
* Mentor junior data analysts and foster a culture of data\\-driven decision\\-making.
* Work with large datasets using big data technologies like Hadoop or Spark.
* Document methodologies, procedures, and findings for transparency and knowledge sharing.
* Contribute to the development of data science frameworks and best practices.



**Required Qualifications** 

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field.
* Proven experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar analytical role.
* Strong understanding of statistical analysis and experimental design.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.
* Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
* Familiarity with SQL and database management systems.
* Knowledge of machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow or scikit\\-learn.
* Hands\\-on experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).
* Ability to communicate complex concepts in a clear and effective manner.
* Experience in handling unstructured data and data wrangling techniques.
* Strong problem\\-solving abilities and critical thinking skills.
* Awareness of cloud computing technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure).
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Prior experience with data strategy development is a plus.
* Strong attention to detail and a passion for data.

title: Quality Inspector - ISO, IPC 610, IPC 620
description:
Quality Control Technician/ Quality Inspector 3
   

  

 Location: Germantown, MD / Rockville, MD – On Site
   

  

 JOB DESCRIPTION
   

 Summary/Objective
   

 Our client is seeking a Quality Control Technician/ Quality Inspector to become a part of a dynamic Quality team, reporting directly to the Quality Manager. The candidate will perform Inspection of purchased parts and materials for conformity to standards, specifications, and processing requirements as materials are received from external providers. This person shall determine or assist in determining methods, sequences and procedures necessary for inspection. Works from released drawings, procedures, and specifications. Adapts inspection measuring devices and procedures where necessary. Candidate would be required to communicate between multiple departments and report key information to stakeholders in a timely manner. Must be dedicated to the quality function and possess a drive to enhance the quality of both the product and processes.
   

  

 Essential Functions:
   

 • Good team player who can work efficiently with minimal supervision.
   

 • Maintain a clean and organized workspace.
   

 • Able to comply with all health, safety, and security regulations.
   

 • Prioritize daily inspection requirements.
   

 • Excellent attention to detail and critical thinking skill.
   

 • Review and comprehend engineering and program requirements such as engineering drawings, models, and specifications and perform inspections using tools such as micrometers, gauges, microscopes, micrometers, telescope gauges, and optical comparators.
   

 • Verifies specifications referencing purchase orders, blueprints, drawing or inspection instructions, and checklists.
   

 • Apply sampling principles to material inspections.
   

 • Makes pass/fail decisions on inspected goods. Maintains records of results
   

 • Visually inspects for obvious defects or damage such as corrosion, cracks, dents, scratches, and pits.
   

 • Prepare inspection reports regarding conformance, initiate nonconformance reports and quarantine material when needed.
   

 • Create discrepancy reports for suspect or identified counterfeit parts.
   

 • Perform inspections per IPC\\-610 and/or IPC\\-620\\.
   

 • Perform First Article Inspections, incoming inspections, and final inspections.
   

 • Assist with calibration of quality control equipment.
   

 • Familiar with statistical process control methodologies.
   

 • Prepare and maintain test data for review.
   

 • Identify areas for quality control improvements.
   

 • On material returned from repair; confirm repairs and product quality.
   

 Minimum Qualifications
   

 • Familiar with ISO9001 or AS9100 Quality Management Systems.
   

 • Experience with inspection tools (calipers, micrometers, height gauge, etc.).
   

 • Experience reading and understanding engineering drawings, aerospace certifications and test reports.
   

 • Experience receiving packages, data entry organizing and scanning documentation.
   

 • Familiar with ESD controls, and proper material handling procedures.
   

 • Adaptable and creative problem\\-solving abilities.
   

 • Must be results oriented and be able to bring projects to a successful conclusion using multiple systems and resources.
   

 • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
   

 • Strong organizational skills and ability to collaboratively work with diverse group of people/teams.
   

 • Strong attention to detail.
   

 • Ability to work in a fast\\-paced environment.
   

 • Qualified candidates should possess a high school diploma or equivalent.
   

 • Written and verbal communication skills
   

 • Basic computer skills including Microsoft Office applications.
   

 • Analytic skills
   

 • Technical Math
   

 o Basic shop math
   

 o Measurement systems (units and conversion)
   

 o Numeric conversions (decimals, fractions, scientific notation)
   

 • Excellent communication skills to resolve inspection discrepancies.
   

 • Be able to adapt to the use of new equipment and learn new product.
   

 • Perform other related duties and be flexible in the factory plant as assigned or business need.
   

 • Must be comfortable sitting for periods of time.
   

 Required Education and Experience
   

 • High School Diploma or Equivalent.
   

 • 5\\+ years of electromechanical inspection, PCB, PCBA, precision, mechanical, or metrological inspection experience.
   

 • IPC\\-610 Certified or able to be re\\-certified.
   

 • IPC\\-620 Certified or able to be re\\-certified.
   

  

 Preferred Education and Experience:
   

 • Experience with use of metrology tools and gauges.
   

 • Experience within the aerospace, automotive, semiconductor, or electronic fields.
   

 • Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings and specifications.
   

 • Experience managing disposition of nonconforming product.
   

 • Experience with Arena PLM tool or other similar PLM/QMS software a plus.
   

 Work Environment
   

 This job operates in professional/secure office and laboratory environment. This position routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, fax machines and other equipment as needed.
   

  

 Competencies
   

 Ethical conduct Strong attention to detail
   

 Ability to multi\\-task, learn and adapt Strategic thinking
   

 Organizational skills Self\\-starter
   

 Strong communication skills Time management
   

 Commitment Demonstrated team player
   

  

 Physical Demands
   

 The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
   

 While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit, bend, stretch; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; talk or hear.
   

 The employee must occasionally lift, carry, pull, push, or move up to 25 pounds unassisted. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
   

  

 Position Type/Expected Hours of Work
   

 This is a full\\-time position. Days and hours of work are nominally Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.
   

 May be required to alter work schedule to accommodate coverage for other team members.

title: Data Visualization Analyst
description:
Savan is looking for a mid\\-level Data Visualization analyst who will be responsible make visualizations that are easily understood and accessible. The ideal candidate should have training in user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) design, with experience in user\\-centric design principles. They should possess strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a growth mindset in transforming complex data into insightful, visually compelling reports.
   

  

**Role Responsibilities** 
  
 * Design, develop, and maintain reports and dashboards using PowerBI or Tableau.
* Collaborate with developers and business stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
* Provide the capability that delivers a report and dashboard content to mobile devices in a publishing and/or interactive mode and takes advantage of the interaction mode of the device.
* Provide support to take the metrics displayed in a dashboard a step further by applying them to a strategy map that aligns performance indicators with a strategic objective
* Ensure data accuracy and integrity by conducting thorough testing and validation
* Optimize report performance and troubleshoot any issues.
* Provide basic end\\-user training and support to ensure effective utilization of reports and dashboards.
* Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in data visualization and reporting.


**Qualifications and Requirements** 
  
 * Bachelor’s degree in data Visualization, Information Design, Graphical Design, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field; Master's degree preferred.
* 3\\-5 years of professional experience in data visualization or business intelligence.
* Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or D3\\.js etc.
* Strong understanding of data analysis techniques and experience with SQL, Python, or R for data manipulation.
* Excellent design skills with knowledge of UIUX best practices and the ability to create clear, actionable visual insights.
* Strong communication skills for presenting visualizations to both technical and non\\-technical audiences.
* U.S. Citizenship
* U.S. Government Public Trust or the ability to obtain a Public Trust


**Preferred Qualifications** 
 :
 * Experience, relevant coursework or certification in PowerBI or Tableau.


**Work Location \\& Schedule** 
 :
   

 Remote OR Hybrid Schedule (Savan HQ, Vienna, VA )
   

  

**Application Process** 
  

 Submit your application to the link on this page.  Applicants selected for interviews will be notified by email or phone.
   

  

**Compensation** 
  

 Savan believes in offering fair and competitive compensation to all employees. Our salary structures are based on industry standards, market conditions, and the specific demands of each role. Salary determination for potential new employees is influenced by a combination of factors, including years of experience, educational qualifications, specialized skills and expertise relevant to the job, complexity, and scope of the role's responsibilities, internal salary structures, as well as the geographic location of the job. Salary history will not be used in compensation decisions.
 
  

  

**EEO, including disability and veterans.**

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age (40 or older), marital status, disability, genetic information, status as a protected veteran, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.* 
  

*If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request reasonable accommodation for the employment process, please email your request to humanresources@savangroup.com. For more information about our company, please visit our website at* 
*www.savangroup.com* 
*.*

title: Manager, Councils Administration
description:
**Title:** 
 Manager, Councils Administration
 



**FLSA Status:** 
 Exempt
 



**Supervisor:** 
 Sr. Manager, Global Industry Engagement Programs
 



**Location:** 
 US\\-Fairfax, VA (while regular in\\-person attendance is not required, candidates should be able to access the office to fulfill job duties)
 



**Department:** 
 Global Industry Engagement
 



**Alt Work Eligibility:** 
 CWW\\-Y, Telework\\-Y , Remote\\-N
 



**Level:** 
 Manager
 








***Starting base salary range is $69,000\\-75,000\\. Individual compensation will be commensurate with the candidate’s experience. Full benefits are available and the position is also eligible for the Manager level annual bonus program.***




  





**Summary of Position:** 
 This position is the primary external liaison to all AVIXA councils and several committees. This highly visible role requires extensive customer service skills and experience supporting volunteer council leaders and members along with their activities around the globe throughout the year. This role will have frequent interactions with the councils facilitating their various meetings and events and must be comfortable and proficient organizing meetings and program agendas, training content and public speaking. The ideal candidate will be able to handle multiple high priority projects and programs simultaneously, as well as concurrent databases managing data on AVIXA’s volunteers/members, maintaining department product inventories, and related event support.
 



**Major Duties \\& Essential Responsibilities:** 




 The primary responsibility will be the management of all industry segment volunteer councils, ensuring their effective functioning, supporting council chairs, and enhancing the efficacy of AVIXA’s volunteer group. Your duties will encompass:
 



**Volunteer Leadership and Council Administration:** 



* Provide robust support for the development and implementation of Council and Committee strategies to enhance the impact of AVIXA’s volunteer initiatives.
* Identify and cultivate volunteer resources to bolster the efforts of our dedicated volunteers.
* Uphold operational standards and the structure of Council local groups.
* Monitor and manage council and volunteer vitality metrics, establishing benchmarks and tracking progress against them.
* Regularly review and update Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to maintain departmental performance and efficiency.
* Plan, schedule, and manage all Council Lounge and Women’s Breakfast programming for in\\- person sessions at AVIXA tradeshows.



**Member Engagement Programs:** 



* Collaborate with department managers to identify legacy processes for automation, thereby increasing overall operational efficiency.



**Communication and Coordination:** 



* Organize and lead regularly scheduled calls for all Councils, ensuring seamless post\\-call follow\\-up with documented action items, recordings, and to\\-do lists on platforms like Higher Logic and Xchange.
* Maintain accurate volunteer member data across various databases and collaboration tools.
* Act as the primary contact for AVIXA’s volunteer online communication platform (Xchange and Higher Logic), offering necessary support when required.



**General Office Administrative Duties:** 



* Handle general inquiries about department programs, volunteer opportunities, and assist in invoice creation and processing from initiation to collection.
* Efficiently manage department calendars and undertake other assigned administrative tasks.
* Demonstrate flexibility by accommodating various responsibilities as needed.
* Oversee accurate inventory records and proactively manage stock levels, issuing alerts for reorder when necessary.
* Coordinate departmental shipping requirements, encompassing programs, attendance at industry shows, and general logistics.
* Collaborate closely with the Expo shipping manager to ensure seamless department shipping logistics for the annual convention.



**Travel Requirements:** 



* Be prepared for occasional travel, constituting approximately 5% of your time.







 In summary, the role is pivotal in ensuring the smooth functioning of AVIXA’s Council volunteer initiatives, involving proactive management, efficient communication, strategic planning, and meticulous attention to detail.
 









**Qualifications:** 




 To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
 



**Education:** 
 Bachelor’s Degree preferred
 



**Experience Level:** 



* At least 3 years of experience working with associations with direct involvement in association program administration.
* Minimum of 2 years of customer service experience.



**Technical Skills:** 



* Working knowledge of CRM’s and online collaboration tools. Experience or knowledge of Salesforce is a plus.
* Technology savvy and comfortable learning new software.
* Communication, oral and written, as well as listening, processing, summarizing, and disseminating information to a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
* Excellent forward thinker and problem solver.
* Working knowledge of online collaboration/webinar tools such as Zoom extremely helpful.
* Comfortable speaking to groups of members, virtual and in\\-person.



**Other preferred skills:** 
 Not\\-for\\-profit knowledge, volunteer management skills, event experience. Successful candidate must be highly organized, have great time management skills, and be able to prioritize his or her work for multiple concurrent projects and tight deadlines.
 








**Why You’ll Love Working Here:** 



* AVIXA is a global organization that celebrates diversity of thought, background, demographics, and experience. Learn more about us!
* The AV industry is truly inspiring, changing how people experience the world.
* We’re headquartered in Fairfax, VA but also have a widely distributed team. We recognize that talented people live all over the world.
* Our values: Trust, Heart, Courage. No buzzwords here. We take these seriously and live them every day.
* Our people: you will be surrounded by some of the most talented, supportive, smart, and thoughtful leaders and teams.
* It’s not all about work: generous PTO and holiday time off, flexible working hours, option for a Compressed Work Week (i.e., 9/75 work week, or every other Friday off)
* The perks: AVIXA offers comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits, 401k plan with company matching, pet insurance, learning and career development opportunities, education assistance, and more!







  





*This description describes the general duties and responsibilities of the position. It is not a complete list of duties and the employee may be required to take on additional duties and responsibilities as required by the needs of the association.* 




*EEO Policy Statement: It is the policy of AVIXA to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons, and to recruit, hire, train, promote, and compensate persons in all jobs without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by law.*

title: SIU Data Analyst (Hybrid)
description:
**Resp \\& Qualifications** 




**PURPOSE:** 
  

 The main purpose of a data analyst is to find meaning in data so that the derived knowledge can be used to make informed decisions and assist the organization in making better business decisions.  
   

  

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:** 



* Engages in data exploration using various programming languages (reading and writing code), requiring knowledge of multiple database structures.
* Supports stakeholder in gathering business and technical requirements to deliver data driven solutions.
* Produces technical documentation that is consistent with professional standards.
* Research and analyze data flow across data ecosystem including operational and analytical data platforms.
* Serve as an knowledgeable resource supporting data questions and issues from stakeholders.
* Collect, analyze, and interpret data to glean insights, and suggest business appropriate recommendations.
* Participate in the design, development, validation and delivery of data to provide insight into business decisions.



**QUALIFICATIONS:** 




**Education Level:** 
 Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Business or related field OR in lieu of a Bachelor's degree, an additional 4 years of relevant work experience is required in addition to the required work experience.
   

  

**Experience:** 
 3 years of data analysis or relevant work experience.
   

  

**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* Hands on experience with Big Data/NoSQL Platforms with experience delivering production projects at scale.
* Experience in health care industry.



**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs)** 



* Quantitative, analytical and problem\\-solving skills.
* Knowledge and understanding of analytical tools, languages, applications, platforms.
* Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
* Ability to learn quickly and take direction.
* Must be able to meet established deadlines and handle multiple customer service demands from internal and external customers, within set expectations for service excellence. Must be able to effectively communicate and provide positive customer service to every internal and external customer, including customers who may be demanding or otherwise challenging.



**Salary Range:** 
 70,848 \\- 140,712
 



**Salary Range Disclaimer** 




 The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the work is being performed. This compensation range is specific and considers factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilites of the position, the candidate's work experience, education/training, internal peer equity, and market and business consideration. It is not typical for an individual to be hired at the top of the range, as compensation decisions depend on each case's facts and circumstances, including but not limited to experience, internal equity, and location. In addition to your compensation, CareFirst offers a comprehensive benefits package, various incentive programs/plans, and 401k contribution programs/plans (all benefits/incentives are subject to eligibility requirements).
 



**Department** 




 SIU Oversight and Data Analytics
 



**Equal Employment Opportunity** 




 CareFirst BlueCross BlueShield is an Equal Opportunity (EEO) employer.  It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.
 



**Where To Apply** 




 Please visit our website to apply: www.carefirst.com/careers
 



**Federal Disc/Physical Demand** 




 Note:  The incumbent is required to immediately disclose any debarment, exclusion, or other event that makes him/her ineligible to perform work directly or indirectly on Federal health care programs.
 



**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:** 




 The associate is primarily seated while performing the duties of the position.  Occasional walking or standing is required.  The hands are regularly used to write, type, key and handle or feel small controls and objects.  The associate must frequently talk and hear.  Weights up to 25 pounds are occasionally lifted.
 



**Sponsorship in US** 




 Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without Sponsorship

title: Reports Developer
description:
Reports Developer
 







 Job Category: Information Technology
 







 Time Type: Full time
 







 Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Top Secret
 







 Employee Type: Regular
 







 Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10%
 







 Type of Travel: Local
 












 \\*
 








 Are you a passionate, experienced Reports Developer who likes working under minimal direction? Do you have expertise in both the extraction of data and presenting it to meet customer needs? Join our team as a Reports Developer! You will get to use your systems knowledge to improve our Financial and Acquisitions System that supports our DoD Customer execute their vital mission. How does the opportunity to help improve the visibility of data for a key Government system sound to you?
   

 We have been supporting our customer for over 20 years with the implementation of a Commercial\\-Off\\-the\\-Shelf (COTS) Financial and Acquisitions System, Momentum. We continue to develop and implement exciting and complex solutions to support the evolving needs of our customers.
   

 We are looking for a Reports Developer with the desire to be a critical member of our team updating existing reports and designing new capabilities for our customer. This includes both standardized BIRT reports as well as developing reports in Business Objects. You will work as a member of the Technical Development Team, developing custom reports relating to Finance and Acquisitions data.
 







 The Technical Development Team will work closely with functional resources, solution developers, infrastructure resources, and configuration change management resources to perform analysis, design, development, testing, and deployment of reports. This includes developing technical design documents, developing reports, and following configuration management processes to deliver results to the customer.
   

 You will have strong technical and problem\\-solving skills and the ability to properly prioritize, multi\\-task and work collaboratively with our project team. This is a great opportunity for an experienced developer who enjoys interacting with people and has a desire to expand their knowledge and take on greater responsibility. Your contributions will directly impact the success of the customers' mission, our team, and ultimately CACI! In return, CACI will provide you with a company that fosters a culture based on integrity, strong ethics, quality work, and professionalism, while supporting your career growth aspirations.
   

  

 What You'll Get to Do:
   

  

 Contribute to the development and documentation of reporting through:
   

 Collecting and documenting reporting requirements from customer work sessions.
   

 Identification of custom or ad hoc reports to include detailed technical requirements.
   

 Translating business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports.
   

 Design, development and testing of custom BIRT reports to meet business requirements.
   

 Design, development and testing of underlying universe or framework to support ad hoc reporting.
   

 Defining, documenting, and executing unit test cases to confirm requirements are met.
   

 Support system and user acceptance testing activities, including issue resolution.
   

 Supporting the functional and technical activities for the customer's financial management and contract writing system reporting tool.
   

 Provide subject matter expertise in support of reports technical activities.
   

 Continuously increases knowledge of Business Intelligence applications/tools.
   

 Work independently with minimal guidance from more senior software developers.
   

  

  

 You'll Bring these Qualifications:
   

 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Systems or other technically relevant degree.
   

 5 years of technical experience in system design, development and production support of large applications/systems.
   

 Strong knowledge of Oracle SQL and PL/SQL, including stored procedures.
   

 Ability to obtain Security\\+ Certification.
   

 Willingness to work onsite in a secure facility.
   

 Active Top Secret or TS/SCI clearance.
   

  

 These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have:
   

 Design and development experience with Business Intelligence and Reporting Tools (BIRT), including
 


* Design and development experience creating dashboards through Business Objects, Pentaho, Cognos, etc.
* Experience with Financial Management or Business Applications.
* Technical experience with CGI Momentum Financials software.
* Possess prior experience supporting large scale organizations with successful ERP implementation(s).
* Security\\+ Certification.

**What You Can Expect:** 









**A culture of integrity.** 




 At CACI, we place character and innovation at the center of everything we do. As a valued team member, you'll be part of a high\\-performing group dedicated to our customer's missions and driven by a higher purpose \\- to ensure the safety of our nation.

 CACI values the unique contributions that every employee brings to our company and our customers \\- every day. You'll have the autonomy to take the time you need through a unique flexible time off benefit and have access to robust learning resources to make your ambitions a reality.

title: Systems Engineer - TS/SCI w/Poly
description:
Systems Engineer
 



 Herndon, VA.
 



 The Sponsor requires a team of Systems Engineers to provide System Engineering expertise and architecture support in the development of technical solutions and collaboration across partner organizations aligning with sponsor's business strategy. In this role, they are the leads for service, capability upgrades and the evaluation of new potential products in collaboration with system engineering and operations and assist with external partner liaison and outreach. The supported environment includes: a virtual desktop environment, roughly, 60 engineers and developers leverage the environment, not including system users, data scientists or analysts; Dev/test/prod environment on the sponsors primary network and joint integration network with Government partners; a mix of physical enclaves (including network equipment) and virtual VPCs segregating the system from the Sponsor's and Partner's general use LAN/WAN environments; and any changes to promote new requirements and the future strategy to minimize the physical footprint by leveraging multi\\-vendor cloud technologies to provide timely and scalable throughput for data scientists and analysts.
 







**Requirements** 




 Demonstrated experience with Splunk, Nagios, HDFS, multiple versions of Linux (at a minimum, Red Hat and CentOS), virtualization technologies (e.g. VMware), and shell scripting (at minimum PERL and Python).
 



 Demonstrated experience with continuous integration and build.
 



 Demonstrated experience and understanding of Big Data and underlying technologies like HADOOP clusters.
 



 Demonstrated experience creating fault tolerant solutions with cloud architectures.
 



 Demonstrated on\\-the\\-job experience in leading complex IT systems engineering efforts.
 



 Demonstrated on\\-the\\-job experience with some combination of Web Services, Service Oriented Architecture (SOA), application integration technologies and approaches, Business Intelligence/Data Warehousing solutions, and data management technologies (Extract Transform Load (ETL), Data Profiling, Data Mining, Meta\\-data Repositories).
 



 Experience with multiple cloud vendors (i.e. Azure, Oracle, Google).
 



**Benefits** 




 • Vacation – 5 weeks of accrued paid vacation per year (i.e., 8\\.33 hours accrued per pay period worked)
 



 • Holidays \\- Paid holidays published annually by the Office of Personnel Management, excluding Inauguration Day
 



 • 100% paid for Health Benefits\\* (United Healthcare, Guardian Dental, VSP Vision, MetLife, Life and Disability Insurance and annual $1500 employer HSA contribution on qualified plans) \\*health benefits kick in the 1st of the month following your start date
 



 • 6% 401k Contribution (3% paid out during each pay period, the additional 3% will be paid out as a lump sum in Q1 each year)
 



 • Training Reimbursement – Approved training and education expenses will be reimbursed
 



 • Travel Expenses – Approved travel expenses will be reimbursed \\*Note – From time to time, the company may change employee benefits.
